etymology.description: Semantic 辵(辵) (chuò, "walk") + phonetic 睘(睘) (qióng, "to see clearly") = returning, to go back
etymology.interpretation: The character 還(還) (hái, "return") combines the walking radical 辵(辵) (chuò, "walk") with the phonetic component 睘(睘) (qióng, "to see clearly"), suggesting a sense of moving back to a former state or place, like seeing clearly the path back home.
etymology.simplification: 還(還) became 还(還) where 辶(辶) (chuò, "walk") was retained as a cursive shorthand for the movement component, and 睘 was reduced to 自(zì, "self"), as a simpler phonetic.

examples.chinese: 他还没有来(他還沒有來)。
考试还没有结束(考試還沒有結束)。
examples.english: The exam is not over yet.

examples.chinese: 他学习很努力(他學習很努力)，还希望得到好成绩(還希望得到好成績)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xuéxí hěn nǔlì, hái xīwàng dédào hǎo chéngjì.
examples.english: He studies hard, and he still hopes to achieve good grades.
